page.title: 12STIBBINGTON AREA TRAFFIC
page.content: The major traffic feature of this area is the A1 trunk road which skirts the village of Stibbington. The A1 is extremely busy day and night. On average 290 vehicles travel south along the road every fifteen minutes. The twenty five kilometre stretch of road between Stamford to the north and Sawtry to the south is a well known accident blackspot area. Most villagers in this area own cars but there is little traffic congestion as most cars are garaged and people use them for going to work. The village of Ailsworth was by far the busiest of the four villages because it lies alongside the A47 which is the major route from the A1 to Peterborough, and also from the East Midlands to the ports of the East coast.
